title: CompTIA Network+ N10-009 Practice Quiz
description: Test your knowledge of networking concepts covered in the CompTIA Network+ N10-009 exam

questions.questionText: Which of the following is a private IPv4 address range?
questions.explanation: All of these are private IPv4 address ranges as defined by RFC 1918.

questions.questionText: What is the purpose of a subnet mask?
options: To identify the network portion of an IP address
To identify the host portion of an IP address
questions.correctAnswer: To identify the network portion of an IP address
questions.explanation: A subnet mask is used to identify which portion of an IP address represents the network and which portion represents the host.

questions.questionText: Which protocol is used to automatically assign IP addresses to devices on a network?
questions.explanation: DHCP (Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol) is used to automatically assign IP addresses to devices on a network.

questions.questionText: What is the primary purpose of a VLAN?
questions.explanation: VLANs (Virtual Local Area Networks) are used to create separate broadcast domains within a single physical network.

questions.questionText: Which of the following is a characteristic of a Layer 2 switch?
options: Makes forwarding decisions based on IP addresses
Makes forwarding decisions based on MAC addresses
Filters traffic based on port numbers
questions.correctAnswer: Makes forwarding decisions based on MAC addresses
questions.explanation: Layer 2 switches make forwarding decisions based on MAC addresses and operate at the Data Link layer of the OSI model.

questions.questionText: What is the purpose of ARP?
options: To resolve IP addresses to MAC addresses
To resolve domain names to IP addresses
questions.correctAnswer: To resolve IP addresses to MAC addresses
questions.explanation: ARP (Address Resolution Protocol) is used to resolve IP addresses to MAC addresses on a local network.

questions.questionText: Which port number is used by HTTPS?
questions.explanation: HTTPS uses port 443 for secure web communication.

questions.questionText: What is the purpose of a firewall?
options: To prevent unauthorized access to a network
questions.correctAnswer: To prevent unauthorized access to a network
questions.explanation: A firewall is a security device that monitors and controls incoming and outgoing network traffic based on predetermined security rules.

questions.questionText: Which wireless encryption standard is considered the most secure?
questions.explanation: WPA3 is currently the most secure wireless encryption standard, offering improved security features over previous versions.

questions.questionText: What is the purpose of a DNS server?
options: To resolve domain names to IP addresses
questions.correctAnswer: To resolve domain names to IP addresses
questions.explanation: DNS (Domain Name System) servers are used to resolve human-readable domain names to IP addresses.
